etymology.description: phonetic: 亥 (OC *ɡɯːʔ) + semantic: 刂; OC of 刻 *kʰɯːɡ.
etymology.interpretation: Knife component 刂 signals actions involving cutting, hence senses like carving or engraving. 亥 contributes the sound value, while meanings broadened metaphorically to time ‘cut’ into a quarter-hour and to harshness that feels “cutting.”

examples.chinese: 他在木板上刻字(他在木板上刻字)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài mùbǎn shàng kè zì.
examples.english: He carved characters on the wooden board.

examples.chinese: 现在七点一刻(現在七點一刻)。
他的要求太苛刻(他的要求太苛刻)。
